p: The examined bacterial and fungal isolates were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC). The selected species of microorganisms are frequently isolated in clinical settings in our region, and some possess multidrug resistance. The isolates included three Gram-positive isolates: Enterococcus faecium (ATCC 700221), methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), a clinical strain, and Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 25923), and four Gram-negative strains: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 27853), Escherichia coli (ATCC 25922), Proteus vulgaris (ATCC 700221), and Klebsiella pneumoniae (ATCC 13883). The used fungal strain was Candida albicans (ATCC 90028).
